articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Art Performance Given by Moranbong Band
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Art Performance Given by Moranbong Band
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by the Moranbong Band at the April 25 House of Culture Monday in congratulation of the participants in the 9th national meeting of artistes. It was honored with the presence of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 When he appeared in the auditorium together with Ri Sol Ju all the participants broke into rousing cheers of "hurrah!"
					
					 He warmly acknowledged the enthusiastic cheers of the audience.
					
					 He warmly shook hands with persons of merit in the field of literature and arts who made contributions to the development of Juche-based literature and arts, true to the guidance of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and highly praised their feats.
					
					 The performance started with the playing of the national anthem. Put on the stage were female solo and pangchang "Thought of Love", light music "The Sound of a Horse's Hooves in Mt. Paektu", female solo and pangchang, "Thinking of the General", serial light music "Series of World Famous Music", female quartet "Dash toward Future" and finale "People Are United in Single Mind."
					
					 The performers truthfully represented the profound reverence for Kim Jong Un who glorifies the undying leadership feats Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by giving origin to the revolutionary literature and arts and providing their precious tradition and ushers in a heyday of Juche-based literature and arts in the new century.
					
					 They impressively dealt with the stirring reality of the times in which a dynamic drive for creating the Korean speed is in full swing, the harmonious whole between the leader and the people based on love and affection and the high pride and self-esteem of the people creating high socialist civilization.
					
					 At the end of the performance, Kim Jong Un asked the performers to come close to him and congratulated them on their successful presentation. He warmly waved back to the enthusiastic cheers of the audience.
					
					 Among the audience were Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yo Jong and officials of party and armed forces organs and participants of the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets WFP Executive Director
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets WFP Executive Director
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, had a talk with Ertharin Cousin, executive director of the World Food Program (WFP), and her party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cameroon
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cameroon 
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to the President of Cameroon Paul Biya on the occasion of the 42nd founding anniversary of the Republic of Cameroon. 
					 The message wished the president and people of Cameroon bigger successes in their efforts to promote national unity and achieve socio-economic prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the bonds of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Cameroon would grow stronger.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets WFP Executive Director
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets WFP Executive Director 
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, on Tuesday had a talk with Ertharin Cousin, executive director of the World Food Program (WFP), and her party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Cuban, Mongolian Ambassadors
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Cuban, Mongolian Ambassadors
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, respectively had talks with German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid courtesy calls on him on Tuesday.

articles.title: WPK Central Committee Hosts Banquet for Mongolian Delegation
articles.content:
WPK Central Committee Hosts Banquet for Mongolian Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) hosted a banquet for the delegation of the Mongolian People's Party on a visit to the DPRK at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Tuesday.
					 Present there on invitation were the members of the delegation of the Mongolian People's Party led by Secretary General Munkhbat Jamiyan, Ambassador Manibadrakh Ganbold and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here.
					
					 The banquet was attended by Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and officials of the Central Committee of the WPK.
					
					 Kang Sok Ju said in his speech at the banquet that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and countries provided by President Kim Il Sung together with the preceding leaders of Mongolia were successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il and are now favorably developing as the days go by under the deep care of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He expressed deep thanks to the Mongolian People's Party for having invariably supported and encouraged the struggle of the WPK and the Korean people for building a thriving socialist nation and achieving the independent reunification of the country.
					
					 Munkhbat Jamiyan said in his speech that the agreement signed between the WPK and the Mongolian People's Party recorded a new page in the history of friendly relations between the two parties, hoping the cooperation would grow stronger in the future, too.
					
					 The Mongolian People's Party will contribute to ensuring peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and other parts of Northeast Asia, he added.

articles.title: Talks between Delegations of WPK, MPP Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of WPK, MPP Held
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Mongolian People's Party (MPP) were held here on Tuesday.
					 Present there from the WPK side were Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Ri Tuk Nam, vice-chairman of the Control Commission of the C.C., the WPK, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and other officials of the C.C., the WPK and from the opposite side members of the delegation of the Mongolian People's Party led by Secretary General Munkhbat Jamiyan.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on the issue of further developing the friendly relations between the two parties and other issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Agreement on Cooperation between WPK and MPP Signed
articles.content:
Agreement on Cooperation between WPK and MPP Signed 
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation between the Workers' Party of Korea and the Mongolian People's Party was signed here on Tuesday. 
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the WPK side were Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Ri Tuk Nam, vice-chairman of the Control Commission of the C.C., the WPK, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and other officials of the C.C., the WPK and from the opposite side members of the delegation of the Mongolian People's Party led by Secretary General Munkhbat Jamiyan. 
					
					 The agreement was inked by Kang Sok Ju and Munkhbat Jamiyan.

articles.title: WFP Executive Director Tours Various Places
articles.content:
WFP Executive Director Tours Various Places
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Ertharin Cousin, executive director of the World Food Program (WFP), and her party visited the Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory on Tuesday.
					 They looked round various production processes of the factory which was excellently built as a comprehensive and modern base producing foodstuff for children thanks to the noble outlook of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu on the rising generations and the future.
					
					 They toured the Munsu Water Park which spruced up with remarkable architectural beauty on the bank of the picturesque River Taedong as a cultural resting place where the people of the DPRK can fully enjoy a highly civilized life.
					
					 They also visited the South Phyongan Provincial Baby Home, etc.

articles.title: Chadian President Hopes for Improved Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Chadian President Hopes for Improved Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Jong Yong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Chad, on May 14 presented his credentials to Chadian President Idriss Deby Itno.
					 The president said.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il rendered sincere support to Chad and other African countries in their struggle for independence and the building of new society. This is always remembered by African people.
					
					 The DPRK is a strong country bravely overcoming all trials and meeting challenges by dint of single-minded unity.
					
					 I hope that everything would go well in the DPRK under the wise guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Chad will closely cooperate with the DPRK in international arena and invariably support the Korean people in their struggle for defending sovereignty.
					
					 I hope that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy from President of S. Korean Red Cross
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy from President of S. Korean Red Cross
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society received a message of sympathy from the president of the south Korean Red Cross on Tuesday as regards the fact that an accident occurred in Pyongyang on May 13, claiming casualties.
					 The message expressed deep condolences over the loss.

articles.title: DPRK Boxer Bags Gold Medal
articles.content:
DPRK Boxer Bags Gold Medal
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK boxer Ri Chung Il bagged a gold medal at the international boxing tournament named after Konstantin Korotkov held in Khabarovsk, Russia. 
					 The tournament brought together more than 70 ace boxers from 16 countries and regions including the DPRK, Cuba and Azerbaijan. 
					
					 Ri Chung Il trounced his Russian rival with knockout in the 52kg category. In the final match he defeated his Kazak rival 3:0. 
					
					 Meanwhile, Ham Jong Hyok, Kim Chung Hyok and Kim Myong Il bagged bronze medals in the 49kg, 52kg and 56kg category events.

articles.title: Kaesong Koryo Insam Cosmetics Popular in DPRK
articles.content:
Kaesong Koryo Insam Cosmetics Popular in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Various kinds of Kaesong Koryo Insam Cosmetics, made by the Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory, enjoy popularity among the people in the DPRK.
					 In this regard, KCNA met Ri Son Hui, chief engineer of the factory.
					
					 She said:
					
					 The cosmetics with Kaesong Koryo Insam as its main ingredient contain extracts of different plants known to be highly resistant to ultraviolet and aging. Among those cosmetics are cream, lotion, moisture emulsion and milk cream, which are effective against melasma and wrinkles.
					
					 The cosmetics were awarded the Q/C and GMP authentication.
					
					 The factory has made big efforts to improving the quality of products in cooperation with scientists.

articles.title: Orphans Enjoy Camping in Songdowon
articles.content:
Orphans Enjoy Camping in Songdowon
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Among those campers at the remodeled Songdowon International Children's Camp on the eastern coast of the DPRK are children from orphans' secondary schools across the country.
					 Under the loving care of the Workers' Party of Korea they are enjoying camping like other schoolchildren.
					
					 Laughter and singing are heard from everywhere they go, including the cooking practice room, international friendship children's hall, outdoor playground, indoor swimming pool, outdoor archery ground and aquarium.
					
					 They wrote down their camping life in diaries in gratitude for the loving care of Marshal Kim Jong Un to them. 
					
					 Pak Song, a student from Wonsan Orphans' Secondary School, in his diary said:
					
					 I am short of words to express my gratitude for the loving care I received at the school. And now, the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un took a measure for us to enjoy the first-term camping at the Songdowon International Children's Camp, the best one in the world.
					
					 His loving care for us is more passionate than the parental love.
					
					 Hyon Ju Yong, a student from Orphans' Secondary School in North Hamgyong Province, in his dairy said:
					
					 It was the first time for me to see the aquarium and draw a bow. I am fascinated by everything of the palatial camp newly remodeled under the loving care of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I extend my heartfelt thanks to the Marshal for his boundless loving care for us. Thank you respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Enslavement Education Policy Enforced by Japan in Korea in Past
articles.content:
Enslavement Education Policy Enforced by Japan in Korea in Past
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- During its colonial rule over Korea, Japan had forced slave education upon the Korean people to obliterate their nationality. 
					 It posted Japanese to an advisor to the education office of the Feudal Joson Dynasty to put the office under its control and then cooked up a "plan on educational reforms" outlining the general orientation of colonial education.
					
					 In the plea of "exemplary education" system, the Japanese invaders did not allow Korea to have any college and university, except high schools as the top education system in which school years were reduced at large.
					
					 Meanwhile, they made desperate efforts to remove any factors of anti-Japanese independence and modernity in the field of education. They enacted a series of evil laws, including "regulations on screening of textbooks" and "law on publications", in order to tighten the control over private schools and thus eliminate all kinds of anti-Japanese and nationalist textbooks.
					
					 As part of Japan's slave education policy, they retrogressively revised educational curriculums, forcing the schools to teach the Japanese language and history instead of the Korean history and geography. In particular, they urged all schools in Korea to use "Japanese Reader" as a must textbook that fostered illusion and flunkeyism toward Japan.
					
					 They also persisted in implanting the feudal-Confucian idea into the Korean students in an aim to make them meekly follow Japan's colonial rule.
					
					 Indeed, Japan's enforcement of slave education policy in Korea was a heinous crime committed with a sinister intention to "make Koreans Japanese subjects" and turn Korea into Japan's eternal colony.
					
					 The historical facts show that the Japanese imperialists are the wreckers of human civilization who make no scruples of doing anything to realize their design for domination over other countries.

articles.title: Minju Joson Lays Bare U.S. Ballad about "Threats"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Lays Bare U.S. Ballad about "Threats"
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- 7.78 billion U.S. dollars were allotted to improving existing nuclear weapons and updating nukes, according to the budget for fiscal year 2015 mapped out by the U.S. Defense Department. This increased 11.6 percent compared with the budget for fiscal year 2014.
					 The Missile Defense Agency of the U.S. Defense Department requested Congress to approve the budget amounting to 75 million U.S. dollars to deploy long-range identification radar needed for defending the mainland.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Such moves of the U.S. clearly show that the ambition of the present U.S. administration to dominate the world has reached a very dangerous phase.
					
					 What matters is that the U.S. is openly perpetrating such moves under the pretext of the "threats" from the DPRK.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. and its following forces that are posing a military threat to the DPRK.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. is talking about the "nuclear and missile threats" from the DPRK. It is aimed to label the DPRK "provocateur", justify armed buildup and thus ignite a new nuclear war on the Korean peninsula at any cost.
					
					 The U.S. had better stop the farce to justify an attempt at aggression with unreasonable arguments and lend an ear to voices of the world aspiring after peace and stability.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Group Is Bound to Be Punished: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Group Is Bound to Be Punished: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Invectives for confrontation let loose by Kim Min Sok, the spokesman for the puppet Ministry of Defense of south Korea, in public appearance are a continuation of the anti-DPRK provocation cases perpetrated by the Park Geun Hye group and a declaration of the undisguised and all-out confrontation with the social system in the DPRK, says Minju Joson Tuesday this in a commentary. 
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The provocation perpetrated by the Park group against the DPRK is aimed to tide over the worsening ruling crisis and evade a big defeat in the forthcoming local elections. But it will precipitate the time of the downfall of the puppet group. 
					
					 Now all the service personnel and people of the DPRK are fully determined to wipe out to the last one the Park group running amuck with bloodshot eyes to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen in a bid to prolong its remaining days. 
					
					 The puppet group is making desperate efforts to divert elsewhere criticism of it and bring the north-south relations to a total collapse. It is seriously mistaken if it thinks it would escape from the deadly strike of the DPRK's retaliatory sacred war. 
					
					 The Park group which dared insult the dignified DPRK, obsessed with confrontation with fellow countrymen, is bound to face merciless punishment by all service personnel and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Japanese Reactionaries for Their Politically-motivated Terrorist Act
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Japanese Reactionaries for Their Politically-motivated Terrorist Act
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Japan Police Agency cooked up the joint investigation headquarters and searched 20 places related to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on charges of "violation of foreign exchange law" on May 12.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a vicious politically-motivated terrorist act aimed to obliterate Chongryon and an unethical crime of hooligans bereft of even elementary humanity.
					
					 We cannot but take a serious note of the fact that the Japanese reactionaries perpetrated such suppression ahead of the 23rd Congress of Chongryon. 
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that on the day when the search was made, the Tokyo High Court turned down an appeal presented by Chongryon as regards the decision made by the Tokyo District Court to allow the sale of the Korean Hall of Chongryon. 
					
					 Lurking behind this is the Japanese reactionaries' cunning intention to tarnish the image of Chongryon and hush up the protest at home and abroad as regards the issue of the Korean Hall.
					
					 All facts prove that recent racket is a deliberate and premeditated provocation and the Japanese reactionaries' moves to obliterate Chongryon have reached a very reckless stage.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, it is the legal obligation and moral responsibility of the Japanese government to ensure the activities of Chongryon and protect the human rights and life of the Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The prospect of the relations between the DPRK and Japan rests on it.
					
					 We will closely follow future behavior of the Japanese authorities.

articles.title: Japan's Moves for Space Militarization Censured by Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's Moves for Space Militarization Censured by Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries seek to use space for realizing their ambition for overseas expansion and reinvasion, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article.
					 Japan mulls launching into space a new-type optical information relay satellite for rapidly grasping the data collected by information-gathering satellite whose mission is detecting the movement on the earth surface, says the article.
					
					 Terming this a dangerous move going against the trend of the times and the demand of international law against the space militarization, the article goes on:
					
					 Japan's recent step is another criminal act of posing threats to world peace and stability as it is a link in the whole chain of its space militarization moves.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' plan to launch the information-gathering satellite is a revelation of their sinister bid to turn Japan into a military giant and realize their ambition for overseas expansion by building a system for spying the DPRK and other countries with the help of a network of spy satellites. 
					
					 It goes without saying that Japan's attempt at space militarization will seriously affect the situation on the Korean peninsula and the rest of Asia where tensions already run high due to Japan's shameless distortion of history and its moves for territorial expansion.
					
					 It is clear that several countries will not just remain an on-looker to Japan's moves for the establishment of the space spy system but will take countermeasures. This will naturally spark a fresh arms race.
					
					 Japan should ponder over the serious consequences to be entailed by its reckless hostile act against the DPRK and its moves for becoming a military giant, discard the bad habit of justifying its criminal acts by pulling up others and immediately stop the moves for space militarization.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Terms U.S. Arch Criminal Posing Nuclear Threat to World and Sparking Arms Race
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Terms U.S. Arch Criminal Posing Nuclear Threat to World and Sparking Arms Race
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- BBC recently disclosed the fact that the U.S. tried to use a nuclear weapon during the France-Vietnam war.
					 During his visit to France in April, 1954 the then U.S. State Secretary Dulles asked the French side what about sending two nuclear bombs as it was facing a defeat in the war with Vietnam. But France rejected his offer as it would impose nuclear disaster not only to the Vietnamese army but to its army.
					
					 This clearly proves that the U.S. is a nuclear war state that does not rule out a preemptive nuclear attack on any country which it considers an obstacle to realizing its ambition for world domination.
					
					 The U.S. is a nuclear criminal state which developed and used nuclear weapons to inflict nuclear disasters on lots of people for the first time in the world.
					
					 In August 1945, the U.S. dropped A-bombs over Hiroshima and Nagasaki, claiming hundreds of thousands of casualties in Hiroshima alone and turning everything in the cities into ashes.
					
					 The U.S. sought to use nuclear weapons during the Korean war in the subsequent period, too.
					
					 As was admitted by the Japanese chief executive in recent days, Japan agreed in secrecy on the introduction of nuclear weapons to Japan in an attempt to unleash a nuclear war in Northeast Asia in the 1960s.
					
					 The U.S. is a state keen on provoking a nuclear war as it threatened humankind with nuclear weapons and has never given up its ambition to put the world under its control.
					
					 The U.S. moves to provoke a nuclear war are part of its moves to realize the ambition for world domination.
					
					 Its strategy for world domination is, in essence, a strategy for a nuclear war.
					
					 It is its scenario for aggression to deploy nuclear weapons in different parts of the world and ignite a nuclear war by using them as outposts.
					
					 In fact, the U.S. has steadily deployed nuclear strike means in strategically important vantage areas of the world.
					
					 It deployed 60 percent of the forces of the nuclear submarines in the Asia-Pacific region including the waters around the Korean peninsula and put in place an emergency nuclear strike system against those on the list of its targets.
					
					 The U.S. seeks a military edge with nuclear weapons as decisive means for realizing the ambition for world domination.
					
					 To this end, it is putting spurs to the modernization of nuclear weapons.
					
					 The U.S. is mulling disbursing one trillion U.S. dollars for the modernization of strategic nuclear weapons in the 30 years to come and allocating most of them in the 4-6 year period after the year 2020 so that it may reach a peak level.
					
					 It plans to squander 17.6 billion U.S. dollars, the biggest ever, for additionally introducing 10 Virginia-class high-performance nuclear submarines to the U.S. navy by 2018.
					
					 It is, in a nutshell, the present day U.S. nuclear policy, to hold an unchallenged edge in the military field through the modernization of nuclear weapons and induce other countries to dismantle nuclear weapons and deter them from developing and possessing nuclear weapons in a bid to carry out its strategy for world domination as quickly as possible.
					
					 Such an action of the U.S. is an extremely dangerous criminal act of sparking off worldwide nuclear arms race and increasing the nuclear threats. It is also a blatant challenge and a mockery of humankind desirous of nuclear disarmament.
					
					 The U.S. nuclear armed buildup in different parts of the world and its modernization of nuclear weapons are inviting military counteraction by countries in the region, triggering off worldwide nuclear arms race.
					
					 All facts clearly prove that the U.S. is an arch criminal posing constant nuclear threat to humankind and sparking arms race.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses Japan of Its Escalated Militarist Moves
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses Japan of Its Escalated Militarist Moves
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The chief executive of Japan formally clarified on May 15 that he would push ahead with the relevant procedures for the exercise of the right to collective self-defense including the revision of laws.
					 On the same day an advisory body of the prime minister called "The council for the reestablishment of legal foundation for ensuring security" released a report the keynote of which is to nullify Article 9 of the "Pacifist Constitution" and thus pave the way for Japan to militarily interfere in all international disputes, in actuality.
					
					 Japan has rushed headlong into its militarization in the recent period. Closely following its lurch to the Right, the world is stunned by such an undisguised state-sponsored attempt of Japan to change the international order which has been abided by since the end of World War II.
					
					 It is an aim sought by Japan to reemerge as an ordinary state "capable of fighting a war" free from its post-war system as early as possible by blatantly challenging the international community calling for eradicating the history of fascism.
					
					 The revival of militarism has begun to be potentially dangerous. Japan is emerging a war force with considerable military capability under the patronage of the U.S.
					
					 Such move is getting more serious as it is timed to coincide with the shift of the U.S. strategic pivot to Asia-Pacific.
					
					 The military operational sphere of the "Self-Defense Forces" (SDF) has expanded to Asia-Pacific from the vicinity of Japan and its military strategy has been fully converted to the one for preemptive attack from "the exclusive defense".
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are now tightening "alliance" with the U.S. under the pretext of exercising the right to collective self-defense.
					
					 It is their view that the "tightened Japan-U.S. alliance" is prerequisite to ensuring "peace and security" in the region and this is impossible without Japan's exercise of the right to collective self-defense.
					
					 In a nutshell, it is their contention that Japan-U.S. alliance might be reduced to a mere name in case the SDF can neither protect the U.S. warships from the attack of hostile forces nor intercept their missiles flying to attack its mainland while conducting joint military actions with the U.S. forces.
					
					 Japan, as a war criminal state, is banned from having an army as its regular forces, deprived of its right of belligerency and the right to participate in a war, and allowed to exercise only the right to individual self-defense by law in face of the strong demand of the international community after the war.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries, always displeased with this, have established a legal foundation for ensuring the overseas military activities of the SDF, as evidenced by its adoption of "the law on coping with contingency in the vicinity of Japan", "the law on special measures against terrorism", etc.
					
					 Japan failed to hurl the troops of the SDF into overseas military operations, afraid of the public pressure at home and abroad. But entering the new century, it has drastically expanded the sphere of the activities of the SDF even to the Indian Ocean in the new century under the pretext of "supporting the U.S." as if it had got a golden opportunity.
					
					 Japan has thus become able to hurl all forces of the SDF into overseas under that pretext though it is not exposed to direct attack from outside.  
					
					 Japan seeks not to miss the opportunity to do so now that the U.S. is concentrating its forces on Asia-Pacific, pursuant to its pivot-to-Asia strategy.
					
					 The recent formal support voiced by Obama for the intention of Japan to exercise the right to collective self-defense is little short of putting spurs to Japan's militarism.
					
					 However, Japan's act of calling back the departed soul of militarism will only bring disasters not only to itself but to the U.S. and the rest of the world. The road taken by Japan at present is the one for reemerging a war state.
					
					 The international community should keep sharp vigilance against Japan oblivious of the lesson taught by its defeat.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Wage Actions for Probing Truth behind Ferry Sewol Sinking Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Wage Actions for Probing Truth behind Ferry Sewol Sinking Disaster
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean students are waging actions every day urging the authorities to probe the truth behind the ferry Sewol sinking disaster.
					 Students in Seoul held a memorial service at Chonggye Plaza on Saturday at which they denounced the puppet authorities for not rescuing all those missing though a month has passed since the disaster occurred.
					
					 At the memorial service speakers condemned the authorities for not conducting positive rescue operation though dozens of persons were still buried in the seabed.
					
					 They denounced the "government" for putting aside the demand of the families of those missing as regard the sinking accident, deceiving the people and making false reports. They went on:
					
					 If measures were taken in time, all persons would have been rescued. Park Geun Hye is to blame for the death of hundreds of persons. Park should step down, not making an apology.
					
					 Students of Ulsan University and other universities on May 16 made a silent march, holding papers bearing the word "Stay put" as a token of their protest against the puppet authorities.
					
					 The students said that they rose up in the action so that they may not feel ashamed before the victims of the ferry disaster.

articles.title: Resignation of Park Geun Hye Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Resignation of Park Geun Hye Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Government Employees Union of south Korea held a press conference outside the building of the puppet government in Seoul on May 16 and issued a declaration on the situation demanding the resignation of Park Geun Hye, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People.
					 The declaration said the present "government's" irresponsibility and incompetency caused the ferry Sewol disaster.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 We can never remain a passive onlooker to the corrupt social structure which meets the interests of those in power only while shelving the security of the people.
					
					 Right after her election Park Geun Hye played a trick of turning the Ministry of Administration and Security into that of Security and Administration, touting a sort of security but she has so far concentrated all forces for the security of the "government", appointed her close confidants to important posts and taken the lead in pushing forward the privatization, threatening the people's right to existence.
					
					 The recent tragedy clearly proved that Park has no capability to protect the people from disaster.
					
					 On the whole, Park, head of the irresponsible, incompetent and illegal regime, has to step down immediately.

articles.title: Exhaustive Probe into Truth behind Ferry Disaster Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Exhaustive Probe into Truth behind Ferry Disaster Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The measure committee of families of the victims, those missing and survivors of the ferry Sewol sinking accident in south Korea in a statement on May 16 demanded the puppet authorities thoroughly probe the truth behind the accident.
					 The statement said that one month has passed since the ferry disaster occurred but no progress has been made to rescue those missing.
					
					 It charged that there were many debates on the disaster in the "government" and the "National Assembly" but no progress was made and media are still making false reports.
					
					 It noted that the wailing of the families calling those missing is still heard from Phaengmok Port and gymnasium on Jin Island.
					
					 It stressed that the probe into the truth behind the disaster should not be confined to punishment of those responsible for it or some measures to cope with disasters but thoroughly be made in full reflection of the voices of the families of the victims.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Is to Blame for Ferry Disaster: S. Korean Religious Organizations
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Is to Blame for Ferry Disaster: S. Korean Religious Organizations
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean religious organizations demanded the puppet "government" take responsibility for the ferry Sewol sinking accident, according to CBS of south Korea on May 17. 
					 The Church Women's Federation in a statement denounced the "government" for not protecting the life and safety of the people. 
					
					 It urged the "government" to introduce a special prosecution system and institute a special law and thus clearly probe the truth behind the disaster and take measures to prevent the recurrence of similar disaster. 
					
					 A religious organization in a commentary said the Park Geun Hye regime revealed its general inability this time. 
					
					 It underlined the need to establish a system for respecting life and safety of the people with the ferry disaster as an occasion. 
					
					 The National Federation of Young Men's Christian Associations issued an appeal calling for forming an all-people committee for proving the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster.

articles.title: Signature Campaign for Probing Truth about Sewol Disaster Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Signature Campaign for Probing Truth about Sewol Disaster Launched in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Ansan Citizens Measure Committee for Settling the Ferry Sewol Issue launched the 10 million-people signature campaign from Saturday, according to south Korean CBS on Saturday.
					 It demanded an exhaustive probe into the truth about the ferry sinking accident and measures for prevention of recurrence. It also called for instituting a special law and forming an all-people fact-finding committee.

articles.title: Poor Security Control Situation in S. Korea Deplored
articles.content:
Poor Security Control Situation in S. Korea Deplored
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean KBS on May 16 deplored the poor security control situation that was disclosed through the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The excessively enlarged reconstruction of the ferry is thought to be the cause of the sinking accident, broadcasting said, clarifying that only one life boat out of 46 was unfolded at the time of the accident. 
					
					 However, the Ship Classification Association had the ferry pass the examination and did not notify it to the maritime police in charge of control and the Ministry of Maritime Fisheries in charge of issuing of navigation licenses, the broadcasting said, and continued:
					
					 Several weak points were revealed in the security checkup before sailing.
					
					 Those concerned of the navigation did not properly examine the security checkup report worked out by the captain  before sailing but approved the sailing, not confirming whether freights were fixed to the ferry or not.
					
					 There is increasing public criticism blaming this on the close relations between the Ministry of Maritime Fisheries and Mafia.
					
					 Ten out of 12 successive director generals of the marine transport cooperative in charge of the security control of vessels and eight out of 11 successive chairmen of the Ship Classification Association were retired officials of the Ministry of Maritime Fisheries. 
					
					 Retired officials also hold the posts of chiefs of 10 places under the ministry, the broadcasting said, stressing that the close relations between them and incumbent officials are neutralizing the supervision power of the security control situation.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Lays Bare Aggressive Nature of Japan's Exercise of Right to Collective Self-Defense
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Lays Bare Aggressive Nature of Japan's Exercise of Right to Collective Self-Defense
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hankuk Ilbo on May 16 carried an editorial disclosing the aggressive nature of Japan's exercise of the right to collective self-defense.
					 The editorial said;
					
					 Japan officially clarified its stand to exercise the right to collective self-defense, an indication that it would become a state which can fight a war contrary to its Pacifist Constitution.
					
					 Japan is working hard to exercise the right to collective self-defense under the pretexts of Japan "Self-Defense Forces'" escorts of U.S. warships transporting Japanese in case of emergency on the Korean peninsula, reaction to the attack targeting U.S. warships in the open sea and intercept of ballistic missiles toward the U.S.
					
					 Japan is seeking to invade other countries by the same force of arms as it did in the past.
					
					 No one knows what extent the role of SDF will reach in case of contingency on the Korean peninsula, the editorial said.

articles.title: Japan's Bid to Revive Militarism Censured by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Japan's Bid to Revive Militarism Censured by S. Korean Organization
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea on May 16 released a commentary in denunciation of the moves of Japan to revive militarism. 
					 The commentary said that the prime minister of Japan at a press conference expressed the will to decide the main orientation of the bill to be amended if it is judged that the revision of the interpretation of the constitution tolerating the exercise of the right to collective self-defense is needed. 
					
					 It went on: 
					
					 Japan is trying to amend the Pacifist Constitution which expanding overseas military activities of the SDF and seeking its rearmament under the pretext of "coping with the situation in surrounding areas," "supporting U.S. forces in Japan" and "conducting activities of peace-keeping forces". This is a declaration that Japan would become a country which can fight a war by unbinding the last fetters. 
					
					 Japan's moves to exercise the right to collective self-defense will escalate military tensions in Northeast Asia.
					
					 Worse still, the south Korean authorities are backing Japan's bid to exercise the right to collective self-defense and advance again toward the Korean peninsula while tightening military nexus with Japan such as conclusion of an agreement on military information.
					
					 Intolerable is that Japan is going to amend the Pacifist Constitution while distorting history and trying to grab Tok Islets, far from liquidating the past crimes of aggression.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should clarify the stand of resolutely opposing Japan's bid to exercise the right to collective self-defense and stop military nexus with Japan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Politics Lauded by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Politics Lauded by Nigerian Organization
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Articles under the headline "A big family" were posted by the Nigerian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on May 11.
					 An article titled "Fantastic country" said that there can be found in the DPRK many noble virtues which are unthinkable in capitalist society dominated by individualism.
					
					 Another article titled "The Heavens and the sun" noted that supreme leader Kim Jong Un's politics is the one of attaching importance to the people and loving them.
					
					 When he has photos taken with the people and service personnel, he kindly poses for photos arm in arm and shoulder to shoulder with them.
					
					 Although he is busy looking after the whole affairs of the country, he reads every letter from the people across the country ranging from children to old men and sends them his autographs reflecting his loving care and trust.
					
					 The DPRK is the only country in the world where the leader and people form such bonds of love and trust.
					
					 No wonder, loudly heard from all parts of the world are voices that even nuclear bomb can not break the gravity-like bonds of kinship between the leader and Korean people.
					
					 The Korean people are highly praising as the sun their leader who puts them forward as the Heavens.
					
					 They call such noble relations described as the Heavens and the sun a big family.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia funcion de Banda Moranbong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presencia funcion de Banda Moranbong
						
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 19 en la Casa Cultural 25 de Abril con la participacion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un la funcion de la Banda Moranbong para felicitar a los participantes en la IX Conferencia Nacional de Artistas.
					 Cuando el Mariscal salia junto con Ri Sol Ju al asiento, los participantes le dieron calurosas  aclamaciones de "!viva!"
					
					El Mariscal respondio cordialmente a tales aclamaciones.
					
					Tomando manos de los benemeritos quienes hicieron aportes al desarrollo de literatura y arte del Juche apoyando fielmente la direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el evaluo altamente las proezas de ellos.
					
					En la escena iniciada con el Himno Nacional se pusieron el solo femenino y pangchang "Reflexiones sobre el amor", la musica ligera "Trote de caballo del Paektu", el solo femenino y pangchang "Pensamiento en el General", la musica ligera en serie "Musicas famosas del mundo", el cuarteto femenino "Corramos hacia el futuro", el epilogo "El pueblo con todo el alma" y otras piezas.
					
					Las ejecutantes cantaron con alta entonacion la infinita veneracion al Mariscal quien glorifica las imborrables hazanas de la direccion de los Generalisimos, quienes dieron origen a la literatura y el arte revolucionarios  y prepararon las preciosas tradiciones de esta rama, y abre la era dorada de literatura y arte  del Juche en el nuevo siglo.
					
					Demostraron bien el espiritu de la epoca por la creacion de velocidad de Corea, la unidad monolitica entre el lider y el pueblo, el orgullo y la dignidad del pueblo que crea la civilizacion socialista.
					
					Terminada la funcion, el Mariscal felicito los exitos de la funcion de las ejecutantes tras llamarlas a su lado y respondio cordialmente a las entusiastas aclamaciones de los espectadores.
					
					Le acompanaron en verla Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yo Jong, los funcionarios de los organos del partido y las fuerzas armadas.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con directora ejecutiva de PMA y su comitiva
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con directora ejecutiva de PMA y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio este martes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la directora ejecutiva del Programa Mundial de Alimento, Ertharin Cousin y su comitiva que le realizaron una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Camerun
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Camerun
　Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica del Camerun, Paul Biya, con motivo del 42o aniversario de la fundacion de este pais africano.
					　En la misiva, el remitente expresa la conviccion de que se consolidaran y se desarrollaran mas en futuro los lazos de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y el Camerun, y formula votos por mayores exitos en el trabajo del destinatario y el pueblo camerunense para promover la unidad nacional y lograr la rehabilitacion social y economica del pais.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se reune con directora ejecutiva de PMA y su comitiva
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se reune con directora ejecutiva de PMA y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, departio el dia 20 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la directora ejecutiva del Programa Mundial de Alimento, Ertharin Cousin, y su comitiva que le hicieron una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong departe con embajadores de Cuba y Mongolia
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong departe con embajadores de Cuba y Mongolia
　Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, departio el dia 20 por separado con el embajador de la Republica de Cuba, German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, y el embajador de Mongolia, Manibadrakh Ganbold, acreditados en Corea, quienes le hicieron visita de cortesia.

articles.title: CC del PTC ofrece banquete en honor de delegacion de PPM
articles.content:
CC del PTC ofrece banquete en honor de delegacion de PPM 
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea ofrecio el dia 20 en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang un banquete en honor de la delegacion del Partido del Pueblo de Mongolia, de visita en Corea. 
					Fueron invitados los miembros de la delegacion del PPM encabezada por el secretario general Munkhbat Jamiyan, el embajador Manibadrakh Ganbold y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica mongolesa en Corea. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes el miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kang Sok Ju, y otros funcionarios del CC del PTC.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, Kang Sok Ju dijo que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos y los dos paises, preparadas por el Presidente Kim Il Sung junto con los lideres antecesores de Mongolia, continuaron excelentemente por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y se desarrollan cada dia mas favorablemente bajo la profunda atencion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Expreso profundo agradecimiento al PPM que envia invariable apoyo y solidaridad con la lucha del PTC y el pueblo coreano por construir un Estado prospero socialista y lograr la reunificacion independiente del pais. 
					
					Munkhbat Jamiyan senalo en su discurso que la firma del acuerdo sobre la cooperacion entre el PPM y el PTC escribe una nueva pagina en la historia de las relaciones de amistad entre los dos partidos y deseo que en lo adelante tambien, se desarrolle mas la colaboracion bilateral. 
					
					Apunto que el PPM contribuira a preservar la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones de PTC y PPM
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones de PTC y PPM
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar este martes en esta capital las conversaciones entre las delegaciones del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Partido del Pueblo de Mongolia.
					Estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana, el miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kang Sok Ju, el vicepresidente de la Comision de Control Ri Tuk Nam, el subjefe de departamento Pak Kun Gwang y otros funcionarios del CC del PTC, y por la mongolesa, los miembros de la delegacion del PPM encabezada por el secretario general MUNKHBAT Jamiyan. 
					
					En la ocasion ambas partes informaron las actividades de sus respectivos partidos e intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los dos partidos y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo de cooperacion entre PTC y PPM
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo de cooperacion entre PTC y  PPM
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado este martes en esta capital el acuerdo  de cooperacion entre el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Partido del Pueblo de Mongolia. 
					En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana, el miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kang Sok Ju, el vicepresidente de la Comision de Control Ri Tuk Nam, el subjefe de departamento Pak Kun Gwang y otros funcionarios del CC del PTC, y por la mongolesa, los miembros de la delegacion del PPM encabezada por el secretario general MUNKHBAT Jamiyan.
					
					Kang Sok Ju y MUNKHBAT Jamiyan suscribieron el documento.
